qas.question: Who supposedly had a vison of Saint Peter on the River Thames?
Who first gifted salmon to the abbey?
Who still gives salmon to the abbey today?
When was the monk community installed?
What was the name of the fisherman in lore that saw a vision of Saint Paul near the Abbey?
What type of fish did the Abbey give to Thames fisherman?
What kind of monks died at the Abbey?
Who, till this day still gives the Abbey a bun?
Who along with the Prince Edgar established the monks at the Abbey?

context: The first reports of the abbey are based on a late tradition claiming that a young fisherman called <a0_0><b4_0>Aldrich<b4_0/><a0_0/> on the River Thames saw a vision of Saint Peter near the site. This seems to be quoted to justify the gifts of <b5_0>salmon<b5_0/> from <a1_0>Thames fishermen<a1_0/> that the abbey received in later years. In the present era, the <a2_0><b7_0>Fishmonger's Company<b7_0/><a2_0/> still gives a salmon every year. The proven origins are that in the <a3_0>960s or early 970s<a3_0/>, <b8_0>Saint Dunstan<b8_0/>, assisted by King Edgar, installed a community of <b6_0>Benedictine<b6_0/> monks here.
